title.narrative: OUTPUT 6.1. DEMAND FOR PROTECTION SERVICES

description.narrative: By end 2021 in targeted provinces, communities, families, girls and boys have the authority, capacity and motivation to protect themselves against early marriage and FGM/C, which contributes to Child Protection â€“ General, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 6: By the end of 2022, women, children and adolescents, especially the most vulnerable, make greater use of quality public protection services (civil registration service, juvenile justice and social assistance).

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021 in targeted provinces, communities, families, girls and boys have the authority, capacity and motivation to protectthemselves against early marriage and FGM/C

description.narrative: Social communication for behaviour change activities carried out in 13/23 provinces reached 137,357 people against the 15,750 targeted in 2021 with key child protection messages, as well as on preventive measures against COVID-19.; UNICEF was able to achieve these results in a challenging context by working with community-based child protection structures already in place that carried out community dialogues and through partnerships with community radio stations that aired key messages. Community mobilization successfully led to 30 communities publicly declaring the abandonment of child marriage and female genital mutilation/cutting (FGM/C). | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:02/02/2022
